fine_dining.name: Le Chat-Botté (Hôtel Beau-Rivage Genève)
signature_dishes: Seasonal tasting menus by chef Dominique Gauthier, known for refined French cuisine with contemporary touches.
fine_dining.atmosphere: Elegant, luxurious setting within the historic Beau-Rivage hotel with lake views
fine_dining.booking_tips: Book well in advance; specify dietary requirements; jackets often preferred for gentlemen
fine_dining.local_tips: A long-standing bastion of Geneva fine dining, offering classic elegance, impeccable service, and sophisticated cuisine overlooking the lake.

fine_dining.name: Domaine de Châteauvieux
signature_dishes: Menus featuring ingredients from the estate's garden and local producers, crafted by chef Philippe Chevrier.
fine_dining.atmosphere: Charming, rustic-elegant setting in a historic wine estate slightly outside the city center
fine_dining.booking_tips: Located in Satigny (Geneva countryside), requires transport; book well ahead; inquire about wine pairings from their vineyard.
fine_dining.local_tips: Exceptional dining experience focused on seasonality and terroir. Worth the trip for a special occasion.

fine_dining.name: Il Lago (Four Seasons Hotel des Bergues)
signature_dishes: Refined Northern Italian cuisine, seasonal specialties, high-quality pasta and risotto dishes.
fine_dining.atmosphere: Elegant and sophisticated dining room within the luxurious Four Seasons hotel
fine_dining.booking_tips: Book ahead; known for excellent service and classic Italian dishes prepared with finesse.
fine_dining.location: Four Seasons Hotel des Bergues (Quai des Bergues)
fine_dining.local_tips: Offers high-end Italian dining in a prime location with views towards the lake.

fine_dining.name: Bayview by Michel Roth (Hotel President Wilson)
signature_dishes: Contemporary French cuisine by renowned chef Michel Roth, often featuring lake fish and seasonal ingredients.
fine_dining.atmosphere: Modern, chic dining room with large windows offering stunning lake and Mont Blanc views
fine_dining.booking_tips: Request a window table for the best views; book in advance.
fine_dining.local_tips: Combines sophisticated French cuisine with exceptional panoramic views of Lake Geneva and the Jet d'Eau.

casual_dining.name: Café du Soleil
signature_dishes: Fondue with tomatoes, mushrooms, or other variations
casual_dining.atmosphere: Historic, cozy, traditional neighborhood bistro atmosphere, claimed to be Geneva's oldest
casual_dining.booking_tips: Book well in advance; specializes almost exclusively in fondue.
casual_dining.location: Petit-Saconnex (slightly outside main center, easily accessible)
casual_dining.local_tips: Considered by many locals to serve the best fondue in Geneva. Authentic and popular.

casual_dining.name: Les Armures (Hôtel Les Armures)
casual_dining.atmosphere: Rustic, historic setting in the heart of the Old Town, often busy with tourists and locals
casual_dining.booking_tips: Located in a historic hotel; offers a classic Swiss dining experience in a prime Old Town location.
casual_dining.local_tips: A reliable choice for traditional Swiss dishes like fondue and raclette right in the Old Town.

casual_dining.name: Brasserie Lipp Genève
signature_dishes: Plateau de fruits de mer (Seafood platter)
casual_dining.atmosphere: Classic Parisian brasserie ambiance, bustling, traditional decor, mirrored walls
casual_dining.booking_tips: Sister restaurant to the famous Brasserie Lipp in Paris; offers consistent French brasserie fare.
casual_dining.local_tips: A Geneva institution for a classic French brasserie experience. Good for people-watching.

casual_dining.name: Buvette des Bains des Pâquis
signature_dishes: Plat du jour (Dish of the day - often excellent value)
casual_dining.atmosphere: Casual, relaxed, communal tables, lakeside setting with great views, alternative vibe
casual_dining.best_time: Lunch, casual dinner (check evening hours), Breakfast
casual_dining.reservation_needed: No reservations, expect queues especially for fondue in winter
casual_dining.booking_tips: Located at the Bains des Pâquis public bath; pay entry fee to the baths to access the restaurant; very popular with locals.
casual_dining.location: Bains des Pâquis (Jetty on Lake Geneva)
casual_dining.local_tips: Unique Geneva experience offering affordable, tasty food in a laid-back lakeside setting. Fantastic value and atmosphere.

casual_dining.name: Chez Ma Cousine (various locations)
signature_dishes: Half Roast Chicken ('Demi Poulet rôti') served with potatoes and salad
casual_dining.booking_tips: Very simple menu focused primarily on roast chicken; excellent value for money.
casual_dining.local_tips: Extremely popular spot for a simple, delicious, and affordable meal focused on perfectly roasted chicken.

street_food.name: Plainpalais Market (Tuesday/Friday/Sunday)
specialties: Huge variety: Fresh produce, cheese, bread, clothes, antiques (flea market days vary)
Diverse food stalls: Lebanese falafel, Portuguese chicken, Asian dishes, crêpes, etc.
street_food.hours: Tuesdays, Fridays, Sundays (approx. 6:30 AM - 2/3 PM, food stalls often later)
street_food.seating: Limited public benches around the plain
street_food.local_tips: Geneva's largest market. A great place to wander, find bargains (flea market days), and grab diverse street food for lunch.

street_food.name: Carouge Market (Wednesday/Saturday mornings)
street_food.seating: Cafes around the square, limited public benches
street_food.local_tips: Charming market in the bohemian Carouge district. More focused on quality food products than Plainpalais. Combine with exploring Carouge's boutiques.

street_food.name: Food Trucks (various locations)
specialties: Varies: Burgers (e.g., The Hamburger Foundation, Holy Cow!), Tacos, Asian Fusion, Pizza, etc.
street_food.hours: Often lunchtime near office areas (e.g., Nations), specific events, or designated spots.
street_food.location: Various locations - check local guides or apps like 'moncamionresto.ch'
street_food.local_tips: Growing scene, particularly active during lunch hours in business districts or during summer festivals along the lake.

coffee_shops.name: Boréal Coffee Shop (various locations)
coffee_shops.atmosphere: Modern, relaxed, laptop-friendly, popular with students and remote workers
coffee_shops.local_tips: One of Geneva's pioneers in specialty coffee. Reliable quality and good atmosphere across their locations.

coffee_shops.name: Café Remor
coffee_shops.atmosphere: Classic, slightly retro, intellectual vibe, terrace on Place du Cirque
coffee_shops.best_time: Anytime, good for people-watching on the terrace
coffee_shops.local_tips: A long-standing Geneva institution near the university and Plainpalais. Classic cafe experience.

coffee_shops.name: La Clémence
coffee_shops.specialty: Historic Cafe in the Old Town
must_try: Coffee or a drink on the terrace
coffee_shops.atmosphere: Historic building, prime location on Place du Bourg-de-Four, large popular terrace
coffee_shops.food_options: Limited snacks, drinks are the main focus
coffee_shops.local_tips: Iconic spot in the heart of the Old Town, perfect for soaking up the atmosphere on its bustling terrace.

coffee_shops.name: Pâtisserie Ducret
coffee_shops.atmosphere: Classic, slightly old-fashioned tea room and shop
coffee_shops.food_options: Pastries, cakes, chocolates, light savory options
coffee_shops.local_tips: High-quality traditional Swiss/French patisserie in the Plainpalais area.

coffee_shops.name: Coffee Lab
coffee_shops.atmosphere: Small, modern, focused on coffee quality
coffee_shops.local_tips: Dedicated specialty coffee spot for enthusiasts seeking high-quality brews.

bars.name: Le Verre à Monique
signature_drinks: Inventive cocktails with unique ingredients and presentation
bars.atmosphere: Intimate, stylish, dimly lit, retro-chic decor
bars.local_tips: Hidden gem known for its high-quality, imaginative cocktails and skilled bartenders. Ring the bell for entry.

bars.name: FloorTwo Bar (Grand Hôtel Kempinski)
bars.atmosphere: Chic, modern, stunning panoramic views of Lake Geneva and the Jet d'Eau
bars.local_tips: Upscale rooftop bar experience with some of the best direct views of the Jet d'Eau.

bars.name: L'Apothicaire Cocktail Club
signature_drinks: Well-executed classics and unique house creations
bars.atmosphere: Cozy, vintage pharmacy-themed decor, knowledgeable staff
bars.local_tips: Located near Plainpalais, popular for its themed decor and quality cocktails.

bars.name: La Terrasse (Hôtel Beau-Rivage Genève - Summer only)
bars.specialty: Drinks & Light Meals by the Lake
bars.atmosphere: Elegant, relaxed, prime lakeside location with beautiful views
bars.local_tips: A sophisticated spot to enjoy drinks and views during the summer months at one of Geneva's grand hotels.

bars.name: Les Voisins
bars.atmosphere: Casual, friendly, neighborhood vibe, often with live music or events
bars.local_tips: Popular local spot known for its relaxed atmosphere and community feel, often featuring cultural events.

food_tours.name: Geneva Food Tour
highlights: Tasting Swiss cheeses and learning about production
Visiting traditional eateries or market stalls
Learning about Geneva's culinary traditions (influenced by France)
food_tours.booking_tips: Check providers like 'Taste of Geneva' or tours offered via the tourism office. Wear comfortable shoes. Book online.

cooking_classes.name: Swiss Chocolate Workshop (Geneva)
what_you_learn: Basics of chocolate history and production
Creating your own chocolate treats (e.g., bars, truffles)
cooking_classes.booking_tips: Several chocolatiers in Geneva offer workshops (e.g., Stettler, Du Rhône Chocolatier sometimes). Check availability and book in advance.

cooking_classes.name: Fondue Cooking Experience
what_you_learn: Proper technique for melting and seasoning
includes: Instruction, ingredients, enjoying the fondue meal
cooking_classes.booking_tips: Less common than chocolate workshops, may be offered by specific cooking schools or event providers. Look for 'Atelier Fondue'.

markets.name: Marché de Plainpalais
markets.type: Large Outdoor General Market & Food Market
highlights: Vast array of fruits, vegetables, cheeses, meats, breads
International food stalls offering diverse cuisines
Also includes clothing, household goods, flea market items (days vary)
markets.best_time: Lunchtime for food stalls, morning for produce
markets.local_tips: Geneva's largest and most diverse market. Great for affordable lunch options.

markets.name: Marché de Carouge
highlights: Artisan cheeses, breads, pastries, olive oils, Italian specialties
Charming atmosphere in the Italianate Carouge district
markets.local_tips: A more upscale food-focused market than Plainpalais, located in a beautiful historic square.

markets.name: Halles de Rive
highlights: Permanent indoor market with high-quality vendors
Butchers, fishmongers, cheesemongers, bakers, delicatessens, specialty grocers
Small eateries and cafes within the market
markets.hours: Mon-Sat (check specific vendor hours, generally closed Sunday)
markets.best_time: Lunchtime or for gourmet food shopping
markets.local_tips: Geneva's main indoor market, offering premium food products. Good place for picnic supplies or a high-quality quick bite.

spring: Cardon Genevois (Cardoon - local thistle variety, often served au gratin)
summer: Filets de Perche du Lac Léman (Perch fillets from Lake Geneva - a key local dish)
winter: Longeole (Genevan pork and fennel sausage, IGP protected)
Marmite de l'Escalade (Chocolate cauldron filled with marzipan vegetables - Dec 11/12)
